title: Citi, in Partnership with FUDEP, Grants Microloans to Women Entrepreneurs in Venezuela
summary: Caracas - The President of Citibank N.A., Sucursal Venezuela, Nelson Acosta, and Mary Gloria Olivo, Managing Director of FUDEP (Asociación Civil Fomento del Desarrollo Popular), awarded more than 60 microloans to low-income entrepreneurs on July 17 as part of the organizations' joint social investment program, "Educación Financiera para la Vida" (Financial Education for Life).
tag-1: Citi, in Partnership with FUDEP, Grants Microloans to Women Entrepreneurs in Venezuela
tag-3: Caracas – The President of Citibank N.A., Sucursal Venezuela, Nelson Acosta, and Mary Gloria Olivo, Managing Director of FUDEP (Asociación Civil Fomento del Desarrollo Popular), awarded more than 60 microloans to low-income entrepreneurs on July 17 as part of the organizations' joint social investment program, "Educación Financiera para la Vida" (Financial Education for Life).
tag-4: Citi launched the financial education program in 2006. Since then, it has not only trained microentrepreneurs in business development strategies but also offered access to microfinancing in communities around the country. The main goal of the project is to give entrepreneurs the skills they need to manage their businesses responsibly and make efficient use of resources via educational workshops that offer both theoretical and practical training.
tag-5: Over the last seven years, the program has benefited a total of 6,400 people and awarded 6,251 loans at competitive rates. "At Citi, we are committed to the communities where we do business, and we dedicate a great deal of effort to improving quality of life, not only for the beneficiaries of our social programs but also their families, by having a positive impact on the community," commented Nelson Acosta, President of Citi Venezuela.
tag-6: Dubraska López, a beneficiary of the program in the state of Lara, commented: "I am very satisfied with the workshops and the advice I've received. They have helped me manage my business successfully. What started out as a vacation project now supports my family and me. My business has allowed me to accumulate savings, renovate my home and watch my dreams come true. Thank you, Citibank and FUDEP, for extending me a helping hand when I most needed it."
tag-7: The program helps strengthen the productive capacity of low-income micro-entrepreneurs through financing and training that allows them to reach their short, medium and long-term goals, explained FUDEP's General Manager, Mary Gloria Olivo. The human resources and financial training it offers help businesses raise their profile while showing them ways to contribute to reducing poverty and improve their families' financial situation.
tag-8: "Educación Financiera para la Vida" is part of Citi Venezuela's social investment programs in the areas of microentrepreneurship, financial training, sustainability and asset generation, and education and quality of life for young people. In 2012 alone, these programs benefited more than 1,300 families around the country.

tag-12: FUDEP FUDEP is a nonprofit civil association whose mission it is to promote social development in Venezuela.
